scenario_name: Slow Flap Operation due to Green Hydraulic System Failure
description: A slow, undetected hydraulic leak in the Green system leads to a catastrophic failure. The Yellow hydraulic system takes over flap operation via the PTU, resulting in significantly slower flap deployment and requiring the crew to adopt non-normal procedures.

telemetry_events.description: At a random point during climb or cruise, the green hydraulic pressure begins to drop, leading to total failure.

maintenance_logs.report: Green hydraulic fluid level noted slightly below normal.
maintenance_logs.action: Fluid topped off. Ground leak check performed, no leaks found. Aircraft released for service.

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: Okay, ECAM actions. Let's see what we've lost... Okay, landing gear gravity extension will be required... and slat and flap slow.

transcript.speaker: PF
transcript.dialogue: Right. Let's brief that. We need to configure much earlier on the approach. Call for flaps at 15 miles out, not 10. And anticipate the gravity gear extension checklist.

context_data.flight_phase_details: Cruise at 10,000 ft, preparing for descent.
context_data.atc_communication: [Callsign], PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN, PAN-PAN. We have a green hydraulic system failure. We are fully controllable but will have a slow configuration and will require a gravity gear extension. Requesting vectors for a 20-mile final to allow for the checklist. Emergency services on standby would be appreciated.
